paper_summary: This paper borrows a idea from the optimal transport problem to propose a framework for evaluating and interpreting semantic textual similarity (STS). The authors use token-wise similarity from pre-trained language models, which differs their method from the previous sentence-wise comparisons between representations, like SimCSE. The method is simple but performs well as it defeats SimCSE on most STS and all iSTS datasets. The authors then analyze their method is both efficient and interpretable for STS.

4. There is a wide range of analyses that support the claims of the authors, making this work fairly solid.
weaknesses:

2. Figure 2 does not show the time complexity of SimCSE_{CLS} method.
